author: JAN WADDY
title: Chef's Palate with Sisters
text: Chef's Palate with Sisters Panama City native Kay Parker Shafer recently returned to the area and opened Sisters of the Sea Grille & Grog in Panama City Beach, where she is now sharing her award-winning recipes. Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 5:27 PM Posted Oct. 8, 2015 at 12:01 AM Updated at 5:27 PM Name: Kay Parker Shafer Restaurants: Sisters of the Sea Grille & Grog, 9952 Hutchison Blvd., Suite 200, Panama City Beach; Shady's Global Grille, Biloxi, Miss. Age: 50'ish (54) Hometown: Panama City, born and raised Culinary school: Traveling the Globe for over three decades Accolades: American Culinary Federation Competitions; 2 Gold, 1 Bronze, 1 Silver. 2004/2005. Biloxi Seafood Festival Gumbo Cook-off, Silver 2006 & Gold 2007. Covey Award "Best Local Cuisine" 2009. Coast Observer "Hottest New Restaurant" 2010. Chefs of the Coast, "Best in Show" 2012. Taste of Ocean Springs, "Best Entrée" , "Best Dessert" 2012. Top 10 Best Steak in Mississippi, MS Beef Council 2013. Covey Award "Best Sunday Brunch" 2014. And a few others.... What I eat after a long workday: Scotch, neat Best food/favorite treat: Jalapeno Cheetos and an ice cold Dr. Pepper, nuttin' like it! Favorite flavor combination: Sweet, Sour, Salty, Hot. My first restaurant was Thai Passion in Biloxi, Miss. I worked and lived with Thai chefs. Their culture teaches the importance of balance, both in cuisine and in life. Favorite ingredient: Currently, I’m crushing on PCB Chef Paul Ashman's Smoked Pecan Sea Salt, made from our own local waters and smoked for 14 hours over pecan shells. That stuff could make cardboard taste good! Favorite local eatery: J. Michael’s. Always has been. Always will be. No. 1 pet peeve: Cooks that smash burgers while cooking and waste all that beautiful flavor and juice. Stop it! Stop it now! If you could choose, what would be your last meal? Chef John Besh’s Squid Ink pasta with lump crab, Domenica, NOLA; Chef Todd English's Beef Carpaccio, Olives, Las Vegas; Chef Chris Infinger's Roasted Brussel Sprouts, G.
